meanings.definition: To abstain or refrain from something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to prescind from eating sweets to improve her health.
meanings.sent2: I always prescind from gossiping about others.
meanings.sent3: He prescinded from watching TV to focus on his studies.
meanings.sent4: The artist prescinded from using bright colors in his painting.
meanings.sent5: Prescinding from negative thoughts can lead to a happier life.

meanings.definition: To separate or distinguish something from a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The detective had to prescind the important evidence from the irrelevant ones.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to prescind the truth from the lies in this investigation.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to prescind the fresh ingredients from the spoiled ones.
meanings.sent4: She tried to prescind her personal feelings from her professional decisions.
meanings.sent5: Prescinding the facts from the opinions is essential in journalism.
